name: Johnson NashÂ¹

topics.topic_text: Will you sign this formal letter asking the NCR to take control of Primm?
topics.response_text: So you convinced those NCR sons of bitches to take an interest, did you? Well, we need the help. I'll sign.

topics.topic_text: Want to play a hand of Caravan?
topics.response_text: You think you have what it takes, kid?

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: I don't know what it was brought you to Primm, youngster, but you might want to rethink your plans. Town's gone to hell.

topics.topic_text: What's the Bison Steve?
topics.response_text: It's an old hotel and casino here in town. Old Laurie used to rent out rooms there, but she took off months ago.

topics.topic_text: You say Powder Gangers kidnapped Primm's deputy?
topics.response_text: Well, you can call Beagle a deputy so long as you don't harbor too high an opinion of the word.

topics.topic_text: What happened to Primm?
topics.response_text: Let's see. Been tough around here for a good while now. Worse since them thugs kidnapped our deputy.

topics.topic_text: What's at Vikki and Vance?
topics.response_text: That's where we are. This here little casino brought some cash and bodies into the town before them Powder Gangsters came in.

topics.topic_text: Do you have anything for sale?
topics.response_text: Sure, have a look.

topics.topic_text: Can you help me find the package I lost?
topics.response_text: You take care of our problems here and I'll give you the information that you need.

topics.topic_text: Where can I get information on the man that shot me?
topics.response_text: {edited line}Beagle had some notes he was taking while he was eavesdropping around the Powder Gangsters. He'll be your best source of information on that subject.

topics.topic_text: I'm a courier with the Mojave Express.
topics.response_text: Well, I don't got any work right now, sorry to say.

topics.topic_text: How can I bring rule of law back to Primm?
topics.response_text: You done everything you could, youngster. It's over for Primm. Ain't nothing to be done about it.

topics.topic_text: I don't have 100 caps on me.
topics.response_text: Well, come back and see me after you find some caps somewheres and put 'em on you!

topics.topic_text: I could see giving you 50 caps, maybe.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I guess that'll do.

topics.topic_text: No thanks.
topics.response_text: If you change your mind, you know where to find me.

topics.topic: JNashInfoSpeechPlayer tries to use Speech to learn about NCR activities
topics.topic_text: If the NCR won't deal with those prisoners, I'll have to risk doing it myself.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Hold on there! With everything you already done for this town, I'd feel ungrateful as hell if I let you risk yourself for no good reason!

topics.topic_text: How's Primm these days?
topics.response_text: We got rule of law again, but of the martial variety. NCR orders us around like junior soldiers. Better than lawlessness, though.

topics.topic_text: Why do you keep calling them Gangsters? I thought they were called Powder Gangers.
topics.response_text: Gangers, gangsters, all sounds like trouble to me.

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: Johnson Nash's my name. Husband to Ruby Nash. Lived in Primm going on eight years now, thick and thin.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about this job? <Show Delivery Order>
topics.response_text: Oh, so you're talking about one of{emph}them packages. That job had strange written all over it. But we couldn't turn down the caps.

topics.topic_text: I have some questions about Primm.
topics.response_text: Well,{deep breath}I'll answer what I can.

topics.topic_text: I have some more questions about Primm.
topics.response_text: Ask away.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to ask you about something else.
topics.response_text: I guess I don't have anywhere better to be.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Don't go getting yourself shot.

topics.topic_text: What about Primm Slim? Could he be sheriff?
topics.response_text: Well I guess I never thought of that. I guess he could be sheriff, if you think he could be reprogrammed for it.

topics.topic_text: I have some questions about your robot.
topics.response_text: {New Line}That beat up old thing? What do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: Do you know where I can find the courier office?
topics.response_text: Sure do. I run the courier office out of my shop. Leastaways I did before things went to hell around here.

topics.topic_text: What was strange about it?
topics.response_text: That cowboy robot had us hire six couriers. Each was carrying something a little different. A pair of dice, a chess piece, that kind of stuff.

topics.topic_text: Some men stole my package. A man in a checkered suit and some thugs. Did they pass this way?
topics.response_text: {edited line}Well, now that you mention it, a few nights back one of the townies was out scavenging for supplies.

topics.topic_text: Where did it come from?
topics.response_text: {New Line}A courier dropped it off a couple months back. I got it working for a little while, but the darn thing pooped out.

topics.topic_text: What is wrong with it?
topics.response_text: {New Line}Hell if I know. I don't think its serious, but my tinkering days are long gone.

topics.topic_text: Do you mind if I try to fix it?
topics.response_text: {New Line}You're welcome to try. Its yours if you can get it working.

topics.topic_text: One of those men shot me. I need to know the best way to get to them.
topics.response_text: {edited line}Well for that your best bet is going to be talking to Deputy Beagle.

topics.topic_text: Cowboy robot? You mean the one over there?
topics.response_text: Nope. Different fella. Bigger. Had himself a face on a screen, and he talked more like you or me.

topics.topic_text: Cowboy robot? You mean Primm Slim?
topics.response_text: Nope. Different fella. Bigger. Had himself a face on a screen, and he talked more like you or me.

topics.topic_text: He canceled?
topics.response_text: {Confused, whole thing was strange, slow}Yeah, got this look when he saw you next down on the Courier list. His expression turned right around, asked me if your name was for real.{Previous text below}

topics.topic_text: Do you know who he was? Where he went?
topics.response_text: No idea. Sounds like you two had a history for him to act like that. And turn down the money, too.{Previous Text Below.}

topics.topic_text: I have some questions about ED-E.
topics.response_text: {New Line}That beat up old pile of bolts? What do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: Where did it come from?
topics.response_text: {New Line}A courier dropped it off a little bit ago. I'd hoped to get it up and running for some courier work, but never could get it running.

topics.topic_text: Did you ever hear it say anything odd?
topics.response_text: {New Line}Can't say that I have, of course I never saw it running for long, so I never heard it do much of anything.

topics.topic_text: Any idea what I should do with it?
topics.response_text: {New Line}Not a bit. I imagine there must be some people around curious about that kind of technology.

topics.topic_text: VEndingPrimm
topics.response_text: {Narrating}Primm, already torn apart by Powder Gangers, was dealt a killing blow by the Courier.

topics.topic: VMS02AnyNPCAboutNCRAny idea what the NCR's up to in Primm?
topics.topic_text: Do you know if the NCR is planning to attack the prison north of here?
topics.response_text: I might know something. But my memory ain't what it used to be. Sometimes it needs motivating.

description:
Johnson Nash is a 67 year-old African American Male.

Johnson Nash is an elderly African American man and a long-time resident of Primm. Along with his wife Ruby, he manages the town's Mojave Express outpost, handling packages and trading goods. He's a respected member of the Primm community, known for his reliability and fair dealing.

Johnson Nash's Personality: Johnson is a calm, patient, and community-oriented individual. He takes pride in his work and values the safety and prosperity of Primm. He's approachable but professional in his business dealings, always willing to help those who respect the town's rules.

Johnson Nash's Backstory: Johnson Nash was born and raised in the pre-War United States, experiencing the Great War as a young man. Like many survivors, he struggled in the harsh wasteland for decades before finding stability in the New California Republic. Eventually, he and his wife Ruby settled in Primm, where they saw an opportunity to establish a Mojave Express outpost. For nearly eight years, they've been running the business, serving as a vital link in the region's trade network. Johnson has become an integral part of Primm's community, working to maintain order and support the town's growth.
